data.name: [SFDC-2322] Fix renewal contract subsequent linking automation for OSHA
data.notes:
Name:
Sarah Hildestad

Email address:
sarah.hildestad@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
SALE - Sales

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Fix renewal contract subsequent linking automation for OSHA

Use this space to explain what you need.:
Opportunity for a OSHA renewal is created
Quote is generated with renewal line items and Prior Contract is linked properly
Quote is synced to Opportunity and Opportunity submitted for approval
Opportunity is Closed/Won and new contracts generated
New contracts generated with prior contract linked properly on contract object
Existing contract does not populate subsequent contract information for newly generated contract

This is what DONE looks like:
When new contract is generated from a closed/won opportunity that generates a renewal/alignment/reactivation contract with a prior contract linked, the prior contract should have the 'subsequent contract' information populated with data from the newly generated contract
 

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Bug

Expected vs Actual Behavior:
the subsequent contract should populate on the new contract 

Rate the Severity:
High severity, this impacts renewal rates and caseloads for renewals for OSHA teams. If possible, please correct as hotfix.

User Story:
As a Salesforce user when I submit a sale for a renewal/alignment/reactivation and link a prior contract in the quote, when the opportunity is closed/won the new contract information should populate into the subsequent contract information for the contract linked as the prior contract in the quote/opportunity

Acceptance Criteria:
Create opportunity and quote for renewal/initial/reactivation product
Enter appropriate prior contract number into quote line item
Sync quote to opportunity
Submit opportunity and have closed/won
Newly generated contract information should populate to subsequent contract information on prior contract object

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
NOT APPLICABLE

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
.

How important is this to your daily work?:
Critical

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Multiple People

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
50-500

Additional Context:
Please also see Justins ticket for the same thing with PQ side [SFDC-602] Fix renewal contract subsequent linking automation

Opportunity example:
https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Opportunity/006Ub00000OpaIEIAZ/view 
Prior Contract: (no subsequent linked)
https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Contract/8004X000001lYW7QAM/view
New Contract: (Generated from opportunity, Prior linked)
https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Contract/800Ub00000Xd8PNIAZ/view

———————————————
This task was submitted through Technology Solutions Ticketing
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-2342] [SFDC] Integrate Calendly with Salesforce
data.notes:
Summary
Implement a secure, scalable Calendly ↔ Salesforce integration to automate meeting scheduling data flow. The integration will create/update Leads/Contacts/Events, handle reschedules/cancellations, and trigger follow-up tasks and notifications to reduce manual entry and improve pipeline visibility across Sales, Marketing, and Client Success.

Value or Impact

    Eliminates repetitive manual data entry and logging, saving significant operational hours
    Centralizes meeting activity in Salesforce to improve reporting, SLAs, and conversion tracking (Calendly → Demo → Opportunity)
    Improves rep and client experience; aligns with ESCAPE pillars (primary: Automate & Anticipate; secondary: Centralize, Experience)
    Impacts 500+ external customers and cross-functional teams including Sales, Client Success, Marketing, IT & Engineering, and Data

Acceptance Criteria

    Calendly Salesforce managed package installed (sandbox → production)
    OAuth connection authenticated and secured
    Field mapping document finalized
    Duplicate prevention logic implemented
    Automated Flows for task and notification creation
    Data validation tested and approved by Sales Ops
    Production deployment and user training complete
    95% of Calendly meetings logged in Salesforce automatically
    50% reduction in manual data entry time
    90% reduction in missed meeting records within 30 days post-launch

Technical Details

    Calendly for Salesforce managed package (Teams/Enterprise)
    OAuth 2.0 authentication with scopes: api, refresh_token, offline_access
    Token stored securely in SSC vault
    Integration user with least privilege and FLS on custom fields
    Salesforce Flows for status updates, task creation, and notifications (Slack/Email)
    Duplicate prevention via email match with rules for Lead/Contact update vs create
    Sandbox-first deployment with migration to production after validation
    Field mappings: Invitee Name → Lead.Name, Email → Lead.Email, Company → Lead.Company, Meeting Type → Event.Subject, Date/Time → Event.StartDateTime, Custom Question → Lead.Prequal_Platform__c

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Objects: Lead, Contact, Event, Tasks, Flows/Process Automation, Dashboards/Reports
    Custom fields (e.g., Lead.Prequal_Platform__c)
    Calendly (Teams/Enterprise)
    Slack/Email notification systems
    Security/IT for OAuth approval and token management
    Confluence for documentation

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Task assigned to https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211080817815794
    Lift set to 28 hrs - Epic-Level with due date Nov 22, 2025
    Implementation follows 9-phase approach: Preparation → Package Installation → Authentication → Data Mapping → Automation Logic → Security → Testing → Production Deployment → Reporting
    Cross-functional coordination required with Sales, Client Success, Marketing, IT & Engineering, and Data teams
    Reporting deliverables include dashboards showing meetings per rep, Lead → Opportunity conversion rate, and no-show tracking

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary

Implement a secure, scalable Calendly ↔ Salesforce integration to automate meeting scheduling data flow. The integration will create/update Leads/Contacts/Events, handle reschedules/cancellations, and trigger follow-up tasks and notifications—reducing manual entry and improving pipeline visibility across Sales, Marketing, and Client Success.

Value

    Eliminates repetitive manual data entry and logging, saving significant operational hours.
    Centralizes meeting activity in Salesforce to improve reporting, SLAs, and conversion tracking (Calendly → Demo → Opportunity).
    Improves experience for reps and clients; supports SSC's ESCAPE "Automate & Anticipate" pillar (secondary: Centralize, Experience).

Acceptance Criteria

Deliverables-   Calendly Salesforce managed package installed (sandbox → production).-   OAuth connection authenticated and secured.    Field mapping document finalized.
    Duplicate prevention logic implemented.
    Automated Flows for task and notification creation.
    Data validation tested and approved by Sales Ops.
    Production deployment + user training complete.

Detailed Implementation Steps (Engineering Subtasks)
Phase 1 – Preparation

    Confirm Salesforce edition (Enterprise +) and Calendly Teams/Enterprise plan.
    Request IT Security approval for OAuth scopes (api, refresh_token, offline_access).
    Provision Salesforce sandbox and create integration user profile with minimal object access.

Phase 2 – Package Installation

    Install Calendly for Salesforce managed package in sandbox.
    Approve permissions for standard users and admins.
    Document installation path and version in Confluence.

Phase 3 – Authentication & Connection

    Open Salesforce → App Launcher → Calendly Setup Wizard.
    Authenticate via SSC Calendly Admin account (OAuth 2.0).
    Select org-wide or user-group connection scope.
    Validate connection by booking a test meeting.

Phase 4 – Data Mapping

    Invitee Name → Lead.Name
    Email → Lead.Email
    Company → Lead.Company
    Meeting Type → Event.Subject
    Date/Time → Event.StartDateTime
    Custom Question ("Which platform?") → Lead.Prequal_Platform__c
    Export mapping table to Confluence and validate via test bookings.

Phase 5 – Automation Logic

    Record rules: match by email to prevent duplicates; if Lead exists → update; else create. If Contact exists → attach meeting to Contact.
    Enable event logging (Scheduled/Rescheduled/Canceled).
    Build Salesforce Flow triggered on new Calendly Event:    -   Update Lead Status → "Meeting Scheduled."    -   Create follow-up Task for rep.        Send Slack/Email notification to rep and manager.


Phase 6 – Security & Access

    Restrict integration user to necessary objects (Lead, Contact, Event).
    Apply FLS for custom fields.
    Store OAuth token in SSC password vault.
    Verify logging of API calls for audit trail.

Phase 7 – Testing & Validation

    Run test bookings from multiple Calendly users.
    Validate record creation, updates, and duplicate handling.
    Confirm Events and Flows trigger correctly.
    Obtain sign-off from Sales Ops lead.

Phase 8 – Production Deployment

    Migrate sandbox config to production.
    Re-authenticate OAuth connection.
    Run live booking validation test.
    Announce rollout via #sales-systems Slack channel.

Phase 9 – Reporting & Monitoring

    Build Salesforce dashboard showing:    -   Meetings per rep    -   Lead → Opportunity conversion rate        No-show rate

    Schedule weekly email summary to Sales Director.
    
    Establish monthly audit routine for data integrity.

KPIs / Success Metrics

    95% of Calendly meetings logged in Salesforce automatically.
    50% reduction in manual data entry time.
    90% reduction in missed meeting records within 30 days post-launch.
    Improved Lead-to-Meeting conversion visibility for executive reporting.

Completion Checklist

    Calendly package installed (sandbox → production)
    OAuth authenticated and secured
    Field mappings validated
    Automation Flows live
    Security review approved
    Dashboards published
    Training delivered to SDRs and ISRs

What DONE looks like

    Centralized visibility of all Calendly-scheduled meetings within Salesforce.
    Automatic CRM updates reduce data lag and manual entry by >50%.
    Improved pipeline conversion tracking for SDR → ISR → Client Success handoffs.

Technical Requirements

    Calendly for Salesforce managed package (Teams/Enterprise).
    Salesforce edition with API access (Enterprise+).
    OAuth 2.0 authentication; scopes: api, refresh_token, offline_access; token stored securely (SSC vault).
    Integration user with least privilege; FLS on custom fields.
    Salesforce Flows for status updates, task creation, and notifications (Slack/Email).
    Duplicate prevention via email match; rules for Lead/Contact update vs create.
    Sandbox-first deployment, with migration to production after validation.
    Reporting: Salesforce dashboards and scheduled summary emails.
    Logging/auditability of API calls.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Objects: Lead, Contact, Event; custom fields (e.g., Lead.Prequal_Platform__c); Tasks; Flows/Process Automation; Dashboards/Reports.
    Calendly (Teams/Enterprise).
    Notifications: Slack/Email (for rep and manager alerts).
    Security/IT: OAuth approval and token management.
    Documentation: Confluence for install path, versioning, mapping table.

Triage Notes

    Requester: Yvette Lincoln (ADMR); Approved by manager; Impacts External Customers (500+); Personal Priority: Critical.
    Scope involves multi-system coordination (Calendly, Salesforce, Security, Slack/Email, Reporting) and cross-functional teams (Sales, Client Success, Marketing, IT & Engineering, Data).
    Validation focus: data mapping accuracy, duplicate prevention, ownership assignment, event state changes (scheduled/rescheduled/canceled), and Flow triggers.
    Reporting deliverables include meetings per rep, conversion rate, and no-show tracking with weekly distribution.
    Aligns with ESCAPE: A – Automate & Anticipate (primary), plus Centralize and Experience.

data.name: [SFDC-2380] Reverse Pardot MQL Retroactive Push to Sales
data.notes:
SFDC Description Enrichment Summary

1. Summary
A Pardot automation rule change inadvertently sent all historical form submissions to the Sales Inbound team, creating 500+ MQLs overnight and ignoring the intended score threshold of >100. This has overloaded the sales queue, buried legitimate hot leads, and skewed MQL metrics, requiring immediate reversal of the retroactive push and correction of the automation logic.

2. Value or Impact
This issue critically impacts Sales team productivity and revenue generation by preventing them from identifying and contacting genuine hot leads among 500+ incorrectly routed historical submissions. The data skew affects Marketing metrics accuracy, while 10-49 staff members across Sales and Marketing departments cannot effectively perform their daily work until resolved.

3. Acceptance Criteria
• All retroactively pushed MQLs (500+) removed from Sales Inbound queue
• Pardot automation rule corrected to only trigger when prospect score >100
• Historical form submissions no longer being sent to Inbound team
• Current hot leads visible and accessible in the queue
• MQL metrics restored to accurate state
• Verification that new submissions follow correct scoring threshold

4. Technical Details
The issue involves Pardot automation rules that process form submissions and create MQLs in Salesforce. The misconfigured rule is sending all historical Prospect data regardless of score value, when it should only trigger for prospects with scores exceeding 100. Integration points include Pardot-to-Salesforce MQL creation, lead scoring mechanisms, and the Inbound team queue assignment logic.

5. Affected Systems
• Pardot automation rules and scoring engine
• Salesforce MQL object and queue management
• Inbound team lead assignment workflow
• Sales Cloud lead routing
• Marketing Cloud metrics and reporting
• Form submission processing pipeline

6. Next Steps or Analyst Notes
Immediate action required to prevent further degradation of Sales operations. Recommend: (1) Temporarily disable the problematic Pardot rule to stop additional historical sends, (2) Identify and bulk-remove the incorrectly created MQLs from the past 24-48 hours, (3) Correct the automation logic to enforce score >100 threshold, (4) Test with sample data before re-enabling, (5) Consider implementing safeguards against retroactive processing in future automation changes.

7. Original Description Reference
The original detailed description has been retained in the task. Key excerpt: "An automation rule was added to Pardot to send all forms to Inbound Team, however, it took all Prospect data historically and sent it to inbound..."

Title Status: Title standardized to: [SFDC-2380] Reverse Pardot MQL Retroactive Push to Sales

Lift-Based Timeline Review: Current Lift is set to "3 hrs - Medium" with due date Oct 26 2025. Based on the critical nature and complexity of reversing 500+ MQL records and fixing automation logic, this appears appropriately aligned with the 4-day timeline for Medium tasks.

Technical content preserved with structured clarity. Ready for R4 – Prioritization+.

data.name: [SFDC-2351] Fix Stripe Link payment sync
data.notes:
Summary
Payments completed via Stripe using the "Link" method succeed in Stripe but do not post to Salesforce, leaving related invoices with an outstanding balance. One prior "Link" payment posted as "Online- Stripe DC," but subsequent similar payments did not sync.

Value or Impact

    Ensures accurate and timely revenue recognition and reduces manual reconciliation by Finance.
    Prevents incorrect customer account status and downstream reporting discrepancies.
    Affects multiple users in Finance and impacts revenue tracking across the organization.

Acceptance Criteria

    Successful Stripe payments made via "Link" automatically update the corresponding Salesforce invoice to show zero outstanding balance and Paid status.
    Behavior is consistent with other online Stripe payments (e.g., historical "Online- Stripe DC" mapping) and does not require manual intervention.
    Verification performed using at least one recent "Link" payment from production data (with IDs/screenshots captured in the resolution notes).
    Root cause is identified and documented; fix is deployed and tested in the target environment(s).

Technical Details

    Review payment-method handling for Stripe "Link" in the integration that posts payments to Salesforce.
    Confirm event ingestion and mapping for "Link" compared to other Stripe methods (e.g., payment posting rules and payment method-to-SFDC mapping).
    Validate invoice selection logic and payment application rules in Salesforce (invoice matching and status update).
    Capture observability details (logs or run history) for the failing path vs. a working payment method.

Affected Systems

    Stripe (Payment processing; "Link" payment method)
    Salesforce (Invoices/Payment application and related posting logic)
    Integration layer processing Stripe → Salesforce sync (webhooks/processors, as applicable)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Pull sample Stripe "Link" charges/payment intents that did not post and one that did.
    Compare webhook events received, mapping of payment method, and posting path to SFDC.
    Inspect Salesforce logs/flows/integration job for failures or filtering on payment method.
    Implement fix, test with a recent production "Link" payment, and document outcome.

Reporter: Julyanne Fae Astorga (FIN - Finance & Strategy), approved by manager.
Impact: Multiple people; Critical priority; Revenue impact; Multi-System Coordination.
Observed variance: One prior "Link" payment posted as "Online- Stripe DC"; later "Link" payments did not post.

----------------------------------------

data.name: [SFDC-2364] Enable Televerde file uploads and owner changes
data.notes:
Summary
Televerde sales users need the ability to upload files to Account, Contact, and Opportunity records and to change the Admin Owner when taking over an Account, reducing dependency on specific individuals and improving data hygiene.

Value or Impact

    Reduces handoffs and delays for the sales team
    Improves data hygiene and timeliness on Accounts, Contacts, and Opportunities  
    Increases autonomy for Televerde, accelerating onboarding/takeovers and revenue operations
    Affects entire Televerde sales team (2-9 users per requestor)

Acceptance Criteria

    Televerde users can upload Salesforce Files to Account, Contact, and Opportunity via standard UI actions without admin assistance
    Televerde users can change the "Admin Owner" value when they take over an Account
    Changes are scoped to Televerde users only (no unintended broader permission expansion)
    Spot-check: At least one Televerde user successfully uploads a file to each object and changes Admin Owner on a test Account
    Documentation updated for permission/visibility changes and takeover process

Technical Details

    Confirm "Admin Owner": Determine whether "Admin Owner" is a custom field vs. the standard Owner field; apply appropriate field-level security and edit/transfer permissions
    Files vs. Attachments: Ensure Salesforce Files is standard (not legacy Attachments); verify Files related lists (and Notes, if applicable) are visible to Televerde on Account, Contact, Opportunity
    Access model: Update relevant Profile(s)/Permission Set(s) for Televerde users to allow file upload (Create/Read on Content and related permissions) and edit rights for the Admin Owner field
    Validate Account sharing settings and FLS that could block Admin Owner edits
    Testing: Validate in a sandbox first; regression spot-check for non-Televerde users to ensure no unintended elevation

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Objects: Account, Contact, Opportunity
    Salesforce Permissions: Profiles, Permission Sets, Field-Level Security
    Sharing/OWD and possibly Sharing Rules
Page layouts/Related Lists for Files (and Notes, if applicable)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Manager approval is marked "No"; confirm governance/approval for enabling Admin Owner changes
    Clarify which users comprise the "Televerde" segment (profile/permission set or public group) to target changes precisely
    "Admin Owner" is ambiguous; confirm whether this is a custom field or the standard Owner field on Account (implementation differs)
    Prefer Salesforce Files over legacy Attachments; confirm related list configuration on all three objects
    Coordinate with Sales Ops for process documentation and communication to Televerde
    https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672 has asked if this can be completed by tomorrow (Oct 24) on behalf of Devyn

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
Televerde sales users need the ability to upload files to Account, Contact, and Opportunity records and to change the Admin Owner when taking over an Account. This removes dependency on specific individuals (Will and Devyn) to keep records up to date.

Value

    Reduces handoffs and delays for the sales team.
    Improves data hygiene and timeliness on Accounts, Contacts, and Opportunities.
    Increases autonomy for Televerde, leading to faster onboarding/takeovers and revenue operations.

Acceptance Criteria

    Televerde users can upload Salesforce Files to Account, Contact, and Opportunity records via standard UI actions without admin assistance.
    Televerde users can change the "Admin Owner" value when they take over an Account.
    Changes are scoped to Televerde user group only (no unintended broader permission expansion).
    Spot-check: At least one Televerde user successfully uploads a file to each object (Account, Contact, Opportunity) and changes Admin Owner on a test Account.
    Documentation updated to reflect permission/visibility changes and standard process for account takeovers.

Technical Requirements

    Confirm "Admin Owner":    -   Determine whether "Admin Owner" is a custom field vs. standard Owner field; apply appropriate field-level security and edit permissions.
    
    Files vs. Attachments:    -   Ensure Salesforce Files is the standard (not legacy Attachments); verify "Notes & Attachments" related lists/Files related lists are visible to Televerde users on Account, Contact, and Opportunity.
    
    Access model:    -   Update relevant Profile(s) and/or Permission Set(s) for Televerde users to allow file upload (Create/Read on Content and related permissions) and edit rights for the Admin Owner field.    -   Validate sharing settings on Account and any field-level restrictions that could block Admin Owner edits.
    
    Testing:    -   Validate in a sandbox first; regression spot-check on non-Televerde users to ensure no unintended elevation.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce:    -   Objects: Account, Contact, Opportunity    -   Permissions: Profiles, Permission Sets, Field-Level Security
        Sharing/OWD and possibly Sharing Rules
        Page layouts/Related Lists for Files (and Notes, if applicable)

Triage Notes

    Manager approval is marked "No"; confirm governance/approval for enabling Admin Owner changes.
    
    Clarify which users comprise the "Televerde" segment (profile/permission set or public group) to target changes precisely.
    
    "Admin Owner" terminology is ambiguous; confirm whether this refers to a custom field or the standard Owner field on Account. Implementation differs:    -   Custom field: grant edit access and ensure layouts.    -   Standard Owner: requires appropriate "Transfer Record" permissions and sharing model alignment.
    
    Prefer Salesforce Files over legacy Attachments; confirm related list configuration on all three objects.
    
    Coordinate with Sales ops for process documentation and communication to Televerde.

Original Request Details (reformatted)

    Requestor: Devyn Barroso (Devyn.Barroso@safetyservicescompany.com)
    Department: SALE - Sales
    Importance: High
    Impacted: Entire Department or Team; 2–9 people
    What is needed: Televerde can upload documents on Account/Contact/Opportunity; can change Admin Owner when taking over an Account.
    Definition of Done (from requestor): Televerde can make these changes without needing Will or Devyn.

data.name: [SFDC-2349] Group Televerde agents under Devyn’s team
data.notes:
Summary
Devyn Barroso needs the four Televerde agents configured in Salesforce to roll up under "Devyn's Team" for Pipeline Inspection visibility. Currently, these agents don't appear as part of Devyn's team in Pipeline Inspection, preventing group-level pipeline review and forecasting.

Value or Impact
This configuration will enable proper sales management visibility and team-level pipeline analysis for the Televerde agents. It affects Devyn's ability to coach the team, review collective pipeline, and provide accurate forecasting for the Televerde segment.

Acceptance Criteria

    Pipeline Inspection shows all four Televerde agents when filtering by "Devyn's Team"
    Devyn can view aggregate pipeline data and team rollups for these agents
    No impact to other teams' visibility or non-Televerde agent assignments
    Configuration changes are documented for future reference

Technical Details

    Adjust Salesforce role hierarchy and/or Manager field for the four Televerde user records
    Configure team/group definition to be referenceable as "Devyn's Team" in Pipeline Inspection
    Verify Pipeline Inspection licensing and permissions for Devyn and all four agents
    Ensure sharing settings and permission sets support team opportunity visibility

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Pipeline Inspection (Sales Cloud/Einstein PI)
    Salesforce User records (Role, Manager, Permission Sets, Team membership)
    Opportunity object sharing and visibility settings

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Obtain exact list of the four Televerde agent user records to ensure correct assignment
    Confirm manager approval if required by policy (currently marked as "No")
    Verify Pipeline Inspection licensing availability for all affected users
    Test configuration in sandbox before production deployment if available

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
Devyn Barroso (Sales) needs the four Televerde agents grouped under "Devyn's Team" so that Pipeline Inspection can be used to review the team's pipeline collectively. Currently, no agents appear as assigned/rolled up for Devyn, preventing group-level inspection.

Value

    Improves sales management visibility and forecasting accuracy.
    Enables coaching and pipeline review within Salesforce using Pipeline Inspection for Televerde agents.

Acceptance Criteria

    In Pipeline Inspection, searching or filtering by "Devyn's Team" returns exactly the four Televerde agents' opportunities.
    Devyn can view aggregate/team rollups for these four agents in Pipeline Inspection without permission errors.
    No change to non-Televerde agent visibility or other teams.
    Document what configuration changed (e.g., role/manager/team/queue assignments) in an internal note.

Technical Requirements

    Confirm Pipeline Inspection licensing/permissions for Devyn and Televerde agents.
    
    Validate Salesforce user configuration for the four Televerde agents:    -   Role hierarchy and/or Manager field align to Devyn as required by Pipeline Inspection visibility rules.    -   Team/group definition exists and is referenceable as "Devyn's Team" (or equivalent supported filter).
    
    Ensure sharing settings, permission sets, and object record visibility align to show team opportunities in Pipeline Inspection.
    
    Test in a safe environment (if applicable) and then in production with a limited scope/time window.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Pipeline Inspection (Sales Cloud/Einstien PI)
    Salesforce User records (Role, Manager, Permission Sets, Team membership)
    Opportunity sharing/visibility settings (as they impact Pipeline Inspection)

Triage Notes

    Requestor: Devyn Barroso (Devyn.Barroso@safetyservicescompany.com), Department: Sales.
    
    Scope: Admin configuration to align four Televerde agents under "Devyn's Team" for Pipeline Inspection visibility.
    
    Lift: 90 minutes (small) to review roles/permissions, adjust team/manager alignment, and validate.
    
    Flags:    -   "Has your manager approved this ticket?" = No. If required by policy, confirm approval before changes.    -   Need the exact list of the four Televerde agent user records to ensure correct assignment.        If Pipeline Inspection licensing limits exist, timeline may need adjustment.

    Original submission link (for reference): https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-2337] Fix Outlook calendar task sync
data.notes:
SFDC Description Enrichment Summary

1. Summary
Salesforce Tasks are experiencing sporadic sync failures with Outlook calendar events for Sales users, representing a regression from previous reliable behavior. This integration failure is causing duplicate work entry and risks missed customer follow-ups, directly impacting sales effectiveness and customer relationships.

2. Value or Impact
Restoring reliable calendar sync will protect revenue by ensuring sales commitments are met, eliminate manual duplicate scheduling work, and prevent poor customer experience from missed follow-ups. At least 10 named Sales users are confirmed affected, with potential broader impact across the entire Sales department.

3. Acceptance Criteria
• All Salesforce Tasks created by impacted Sales users consistently appear in Outlook calendars
• Sync behavior matches pre-regression baseline (100% sync rate)
• Functionality confirmed for all 10 named users: Joe Romero, Ryan Lugo, John Steinbrugger, Monique Romero, Chris Preston, James Skulemowski, Kevin Marcus, Chris Smolack, Amanda Apodaca, Nick Kempton
• Sales Manager stakeholder sign-off on restored functionality

4. Technical Details
Einstein Activity Capture (EAC) configuration issue identified - July 2025 rule excluding safetyservicescompany.com domain from activity timeline inadvertently blocks sync when domain appears in to/from fields. Solution involves removing or modifying this exclusion rule. No code changes required; configuration-only fix within Salesforce EAC settings with propagation time needed.

5. Affected Systems
• Salesforce: Tasks/Activities module, Einstein Activity Capture (EAC) configuration
• Microsoft Outlook/Exchange: Calendar sync via EAC integration
• Email domain filtering rules within EAC

6. Next Steps or Analyst Notes
Settings have been updated and are propagating through the system. https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672 following up with Sales Managers for confirmation. Initial positive confirmation received from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210024765840547. Awaiting final confirmation from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605074501707 and https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210701781643537 teams. Root cause traced to overly broad domain exclusion rule implemented in July 2025.

7. Original Description Reference
Original description retained in task. Key excerpt: "Sales reps report that Salesforce Tasks are only sporadically creating corresponding Outlook calendar events..."

Title Status: Title already compliant - [SFDC] prefix present with clear action verb and context.

Lift-Based Timeline Review: Current Lift set to "3 hrs - Medium" with due date Oct 26 2025. This aligns with the 4-day guideline for Medium tasks. Timeline appears appropriate given configuration-only fix and testing requirements.

Technical content preserved with all user references, system components, and configuration details maintained. Ready for R4 – Prioritization+.

data.name: [SFDC-2379] Grant Payment Edit Permissions in Salesforce
data.notes:
Summary
The requester from Finance needs the ability to edit failed/unposted Payment records in Salesforce and mark payments as posted, enabling related invoices to be closed. This is time-sensitive due to a temporary coverage gap while a teammate is on vacation and impacts revenue recognition and customer experience.

Value or Impact

    Finance can record revenue promptly once payment status is corrected.
    Prevents customers appearing as unpaid, reducing unnecessary outreach.
    Reduces dependency on admin intervention; improves operational continuity during staffing gaps.

Acceptance Criteria

    User can update payment details for failed/unposted payments in Salesforce.
    User can mark invoice payments as posted.
    Invoices can be closed out without admin intervention.

Technical Details

    Object(s): Payment__c (custom) record provided: https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Payment__c/a23Ub000005SPqDIAW/view
    Required capability: Edit Payment__c details when status is failed/unposted; mark/transition payment to “posted” so related invoices can be closed.
    Access mechanism: (Information not provided.) Note: Likely via Profile/Permission Set update or targeted field-level security for Payment__c.
    Dependencies/Automation: (Information not provided.) Any flows, validation rules, or posting processes that gate editing/posting should be reviewed to ensure the permitted user path is enabled.
    Audit/Compliance: (Information not provided.) Consider tracking who updates payment status for audit purposes.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Payment__c; related invoice records referenced in Finance workflows.
    External systems/integrations: (Information not provided.)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm the specific user(s) who need access (requester: stephanie.bosselaar@safetyservicescompany.com) and whether temporary or permanent access is required.
    Identify exact fields/actions required on Payment__c (e.g., status, posting action) and any related invoice close-out steps.
    Determine appropriate access model (Permission Set vs Profile) and ensure field-level security aligns with the acceptance criteria.
    Validate no validation rules/flows prevent editing failed/unposted payments or posting action for the permitted users.
    Test with the provided Payment__c record before broadening access.
    Related resources:        Salesforce record: https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Payment__c/a23Ub000005SPqDIAW/view
        Intake form submission: https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429


Original Description
————————
Name:
Stephanie Bosselaar

Email address:
stephanie.bosselaar@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
FIN - Finance & Strategy

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Need permission to edit payment details in Salesforce

Use this space to explain what you need.:
A customer's payment had failed and was unposted and I am not able to edit the details of the payment in Salesforce to close out the invoices.  As Josh is on vacation until next week, it is imperative that I am able to correct this ASAP.

https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Payment__c/a23Ub000005SPqDIAW/view

This is what DONE looks like:
Done is being able to mark invoice payments as posted and close them out for customers.

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
This matters for both the business and client, as we cannot record the revenue until the status of payment is changed and for the client, invoices will continue to be unpaid in system until this is corrected.  While we add notes to invoices to not call, mistakes could happen that the customer is contacted again after payment has been made.

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Entire Department or Team

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
2-9

Additional Context:
Josh is on vacation until next week and we would appreciate being able to correct this issue this week to record payments when received.

———————————————
This task was submitted through Technology Solutions Ticketing
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-2372] Fix RingCentral Integration Blocking Revenue
data.notes:
Summary
This task seeks to resolve critical RingCentral–Salesforce integration failures that block sales workflows and impact revenue. Daniel will lead vendor engagement with RingCentral while Tyler investigates Salesforce-side configuration. All changes must be validated in sandbox before any production deployment.

Value or Impact

    Restores seller productivity and protects revenue by fixing core calling/integration workflows.
    Improves reliability of sales operations and provides leadership visibility into blocker status and resolution progress.
    Affects Sales team operations with cross-system coordination between IT/Engineering and vendor.

Acceptance Criteria

    Integration issues are resolved and no longer block day-to-day sales workflows in production.
    All changes are validated in sandbox with documented test results prior to production deployment.
    Cross-team stakeholders (Daniel, Tyler, Sales leadership) confirm functionality is restored and sign off.
    Regular status updates are provided to leadership until closure.
    No regressions identified during UAT with representative sales users.

Technical Details

    Approach: Sandbox-first testing for any configuration or integration changes; plan and execute production deployment only after sandbox validation and stakeholder approval.
    Vendor coordination: Engage RingCentral support for required fixes or settings changes; maintain an active vendor ticket.
    Salesforce-side work: Investigate and adjust org configuration/settings related to the RingCentral integration as needed.
    Testing scope: Functional validation of calling workflows, call logging, and user click-to-dial behavior; document test cases and results.
    Evidence/requested debug: Per https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672, identify a specific affected user to reproduce and debug the issue effectively.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce (Sales org configuration/settings related to RingCentral integration)
    RingCentral (vendor platform and Salesforce integration components)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Identify a specific user experiencing the issue for targeted debugging (requested by https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672).
    https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209127958101691 to continue managing the ticket with RingCentral; track SLA/response times.
    Validate fixes in sandbox with documented results; coordinate UAT with representative sales users.
    Maintain regular status updates to leadership until closure; escalate if vendor response delays persist.
    Current status: High-risk, revenue-impacting blocker; cross-team coordination required.

Original Description
Summary
This task addresses critical RingCentral–Salesforce integration failures that are blocking sales workflows and impacting revenue. Dan is leading vendor engagement with RingCentral and Tyler is investigating Salesforce-side configuration. All changes must be validated in sandbox before production.

Value

    Restores seller productivity and revenue generation by fixing core calling/integration workflows.

data.name: [SFDC-2374] Automate Outlook Emails to Opportunities
data.notes:
Summary
Marketing requests automatic logging of emails sent to or received by contact@safetyservicescompany.com and sales@safetyservicescompany.com into Salesforce as Activities associated to the correct Opportunity. This addresses visibility gaps where first-touch emails are not linked, impacting attribution, reporting, and follow-up context.

Value or Impact

    Improves lead source attribution and first-touch visibility for Marketing and Sales.
    Reduces manual effort and errors from optional Outlook add-in logging.
    Ensures cleaner activity history and better funnel reporting.

Acceptance Criteria

    Emails to/from contact@safetyservicescompany.com and sales@safetyservicescompany.com are automatically created as Activities in Salesforce.
    Each created email Activity is deterministically linked to the appropriate Opportunity.

Technical Details

    Mailboxes: Microsoft 365/Exchange shared mailboxes (contact@safetyservicescompany.com, sales@safetyservicescompany.com).
    Salesforce: Ability to create/store Email-type Activities and associate them to Opportunities.
    Matching logic: Deterministic rules to associate each email to the correct Opportunity (e.g., participants/recipients alignment with known Contacts/Leads linked to Opportunities); final logic to be confirmed with stakeholders.
    Compliance: Security, compliance, and retention review for handling shared mailbox data.
    Existing integrations: Consider current Salesforce–Outlook integration configuration (if applicable).
    (Implementation tooling such as APIs/flows/integration middleware): (Information not provided.)

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Opportunity, Activity (Email), related logging mechanisms.
    Microsoft 365/Exchange/Outlook (shared mailboxes: contact@, sales@).
    Existing Salesforce–Outlook integration (if applicable).

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Confirm mailbox access and obtain stakeholder approvals.
    Document and validate email-to-Opportunity matching logic with Marketing/Sales, including edge-case handling.
    Implement and test automatic Activity creation and association.
    Pilot with a subset of users before org-wide enablement.
    Dependencies: Coordination with IT for mailbox access/config; confirmation from Marketing/Sales on matching rules.
    Risks/Considerations: Shared mailbox permissions/governance; prevention of mis-associations; privacy/compliance for email ingestion and retention.
    Known blockers: (Information not provided.)

Original Description
Summary
Marketing requests automatic logging of emails sent to/received by contact@safetyservicescompany.com and sales@safetyservicescompany.com into Salesforce as Activities, linked to the appropriate Opportunities. This aims to close visibility gaps where first-touch emails are not associated to Opportunities, impacting attribution and follow-up context.

Value

    Improves lead source attribution and first-touch visibility for Marketing and Sales.
    Reduces manual effort and human error from optional Outlook add-in logging.
    Enables cleaner activity history and better reporting across the funnel.

Acceptance Criteria

    Emails to/from contact@safetyservicescompany.com and sales@safetyservicescompany.com are automatically created as Activities in Salesforce.
    Each created email Activity is linked to the appropriate Opportunity.

Technical Requirements

    Access to Microsoft 365/Exchange shared mailboxes: contact@safetyservicescompany.com, sales@safetyservicescompany.com.
    Capability in Salesforce to create and store email Activities and associate them to Opportunities.
    Clearly defined, deterministic matching logic for associating an email to the correct Opportunity (e.g., contact/recipient alignment, existing relationships). Final logic to be confirmed with stakeholders.
    Security, compliance, and retention review for handling shared mailbox data.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Opportunity, Activity (Email), related logging mechanisms.
    Microsoft 365/Exchange/Outlook shared mailboxes (contact@, sales@).
    Existing Salesforce–Outlook integration configuration (if applicable).

Triage Notes

    Business context: Many leads show as “Unknown” source; users often report “Following up on an email,” but the email is not visible on the Opportunity.
    Risk/Considerations: Shared mailbox permissions; reliable Opportunity matching; privacy/compliance for email ingestion; avoiding mis-associations.
    Dependencies: Coordination with IT for mailbox access and configuration; confirmation from Marketing/Sales on acceptable matching rules and edge-case handling.
    Next steps: 1. Confirm mailbox access and stakeholders for approval. 1. Document and validate matching logic with MKTG/Sales.        Implement and test automatic Activity creation and association.
        Pilot with a subset before org-wide enablement.


Original Request (verbatim)
Name:
Lora Duran

Email address:
lora.duran@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
MKTG - Marketing & Knowledge

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Outlook Automation In Salesforce

Use this space to explain what you need.:
We are wondering if we can create an automation to link any email that comes into the contact@safetyservicescompany.com or the sales@safetyservicescompany.com inbox into the related opportunity as "Activity". 

Many lead sources are coming in as "Unknown" and we found that a lot of the calls are saying "Following up on an email". Said email is not linked in the opportunity so we cannot see where the first touchpoint is. 

There is an option to link the email within Outlook via the Salesforce extension, however, this would be fantastic if it can be automatic so no emails slip through the cracks. 

This is what DONE looks like:
Done would be when all contact@ or sales@ emails get linked to their appropriate opportunities. 

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Capability Expansion

Describe the capability that needs to be added to this platform and the features it will support.:
Automate outlook emails into salesforce for their specific opportunities 

User Story:
As a marketer, I want these emails to be automated into salesforce, so that I can hone in on tracking lead sources and clean up existing data. 

Acceptance Criteria:
I would consider this complete once emails are automated into salesforce 

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
A - Automate

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
This will free up time and human error by connect the two sources together, cleaning up data and allowing for better reporting

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Entire Company

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
2-9

Additional Context:
I understand this might not be possible, but want to see if it can happen. This would be a great step in the next direction, especially for paper trail and ensuring MKTG and Sales are aligned on possible touch points. Feel free to call us if you need more context!

———————————————
This task was submitted through Technology Solutions Ticketing
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-2338] Add POC Checkbox and Enable Click-to-Dial in Opportunity Call Reports
data.notes:
Summary

    Add a boolean Point of Contact (POC) field on Contact and surface it in Sales page layouts and Opportunity-based calling reports.
    Ensure the Opportunity calling report supports click-to-dial on the contact phone column via the current CTI configuration.
    Consider surfacing a POC indicator on the Account as a potential enhancement.

Value or Impact

    Improves Sales efficiency by clearly identifying the primary POC and enabling direct calling from reports, reducing navigation time and accelerating outreach.
    Supports revenue goals by speeding outbound calling from Opportunity-driven lists.

Acceptance Criteria

    A boolean “POC” field exists on Contact (e.g., POC__c).
    The POC field is visible on relevant Sales Contact page layouts.
    The POC field is available to report types used for Opportunity calling lists and can be added as a report column.
    The calling report supports click-to-dial for the contact phone number column per current CTI configuration.
    Validation with the requestor that: (a) the report displays the POC indicator as intended; and (b) agents can initiate calls directly from the report.

Technical Details

    Salesforce: Create Contact boolean field (API name e.g., POC__c) and add to Sales Contact page layouts.
    Reporting: Expose the POC field to relevant report types used for Opportunity-based calling; include phone number columns that render as dialable links in Lightning.
    CTI: Validate Lightning click-to-dial behavior with the current CTI integration (e.g., RingCentral for Salesforce). Confirm user profiles have CTI enabled and that phone fields in the target report render as dialable links.
    Coordination: SALE - Sales (requestor), TIE - IT & Engineering (CTI/report validation).
    Related references: SALE-633, TIE-2516, SFDC-2338; Requestor: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1210605074501707, wness@safetyservicescompany.com.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Contact object, Contact page layouts, Report Types, and Reports (Opportunity-based call lists).
    CTI Integration: RingCentral for Salesforce (or current CTI) for click-to-dial links in Lightning reports.

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    WIP: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672 added the POC field and is placing it on the report; considering Account-level surfacing as an enhancement.
    Validate report-level click-to-dial behavior and confirm Sales users see dialable links.
    Confirm with requestor that the report displays the POC indicator and supports click-to-dial as expected.
    No blockers explicitly noted beyond CTI validation. (If issues arise, capture error messages, profiles affected, and report type used.)

Original Description
Summary-   Request: Add a checkbox on Contact to designate the Point of Contact (POC) and enable using that indicator in Opportunity calling reports, with click-to-dial from the report.

    Context: Sales wants agents to call directly from an Opportunity-driven list; discussion is underway about potentially surfacing the indicator on the Account page as well.

Value

    Improves Sales team efficiency by clearly identifying the primary POC and enabling click-to-dial from call lists.
    Reduces time navigating into records and speeds outbound outreach, supporting revenue goals.

Acceptance Criteria

    A boolean “POC” field exists on Contact.
    The POC field is visible on relevant Contact page layouts used by Sales.
    The POC field is available in reporting and can be added as a column to the Opportunity calling report used by the team.
    The calling report supports click-to-dial for the contact phone number column (per existing CTI configuration).
    Confirm with the requestor that the report shows the desired POC indicator and that agents can initiate calls directly from the report.

Technical Requirements

    Salesforce: Create Contact boolean field (e.g., API name POC__c), add to Sales Contact page layouts.
    Reporting: Ensure the field is exposed to relevant report types used for Opportunity calling lists; include phone number column(s) that support click-to-dial.
    CTI: Click-to-dial relies on existing telephony integration (e.g., RingCentral CTI) and Lightning click-to-dial settings. Validate that phone fields render as dialable links in the target report and that user profiles have CTI enabled.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Contact object, Contact page layout(s), Report Types and Reports (Opportunity-based call lists).
    CTI Integration: RingCentral for Salesforce (or current CTI provider) for click-to-dial behavior within reports.

Triage Notes

    Work-in-progress: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672 noted the field was added and is being placed on the relevant report; considering surfacing on Account as an enhancement.
    Validate report-level click-to-dial behavior with CTI; ensure phone fields in the report render as dialable links for Sales users.
    Coordinates: SALE - Sales (requestor), TIE - IT & Engineering (CTI/report validation).
    Requestor: Will Ness (wness@safetyservicescompany.com). Priority: High. Impacted: Entire team (2–9 users).
    Original request text retained through reformatting; no scope added beyond the request.

data.name: [SFDC-2313] Investigate Lead Routing to Resting Placeholder
data.notes:
Summary
Investigate why new Leads are being assigned to and remaining with the “Resting placeholder” user. Review routing logic (assignment rules, flows, default owner settings, queues, and any overrides) to identify the root cause and recommend corrective actions. The goal is to restore expected lead ownership and prevent stalling.

Value or Impact

    Prevents Leads from stalling on a placeholder, improving speed-to-contact and conversion.
    Restores confidence in routing automations for Sales, protecting pipeline and revenue.
    Affects Sales users and any integrations or automations that set or change Lead OwnerId.

Acceptance Criteria

    Root cause documented for Leads assigned to or remaining with “Resting placeholder.”
    Inventory of routing assets reviewed: Lead Assignment Rules, Flows, Queues, Default Lead Owner, and any Process Builder/Apex/Triggers.
    Clear decision path contrasting expected routing vs. observed behavior.
    Recommended corrective actions with affected components listed.
    Validation plan with test cases proving Leads no longer strand on placeholder post-fix.
    Findings and next steps shared in task notes and confirmed with requester https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1207031591185757.

Technical Details

    Review Lead Assignment Rules (order, criteria, active entries).
    Review record-triggered flows on Lead for creation/update ownership logic.
    Check default owner settings (Default Lead Owner, Web-to-Lead default owner) and any Queue handoffs.
    Confirm any Process Builder, Apex, or Trigger logic that may override OwnerId.
    Identify scheduled jobs or integrations that may reassign Leads post-creation.
    Reference: SFDC ticket ID SFDC-2313.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Lead object.
    Salesforce automation: Lead Assignment Rules, Record-Triggered Flows (Lead), Queues, Default Lead Owner configuration.
    Potentially: Process Builder (legacy), Apex Triggers/Classes, Integrations that set OwnerId.

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Pull recent Leads assigned to “Resting placeholder” and review creation sources/timestamps.
    Trace routing path: assignment rule evaluation, flow decisions, and any OwnerId updates.
    Compare expected rule criteria vs. actual Lead field values at creation.
    Document root cause and propose remediation with minimal disruption to current routing.
    Related resources:        Requester: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1207031591185757
        Internal reference: SFDC-2313

    (No blockers reported yet; update as findings emerge.)

Original Description

Summary

Request from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1207031591185757 to investigate why new Leads are being assigned to and remaining with the “Resting placeholder” user. The goal is to review lead routing logic (assignment rules, flows, default owner settings) to identify the root cause and recommend corrective action. This is an investigation-first task to understand the full lead routing picture.

Value

    Prevents Leads from stalling on a placeholder, improving speed-to-contact and conversion.
    Restores confidence in routing automations for the Sales team, protecting pipeline and revenue.

Acceptance Criteria

    Documented root cause of why Leads are assigned to and/or remain with the “Resting placeholder” user.
    Inventory of relevant automation and routing assets reviewed (Lead Assignment Rules, Flows, Queues, Default Lead Owner, any Apex/Process/Triggers if applicable).
    Clear decision path of how a Lead is expected to route today vs. observed behavior.
    Recommendation(s) for corrective action, with affected components listed.
    Validation plan including one or more test cases that demonstrate Leads no longer get stranded on the placeholder (to be used once a fix is implemented).
    Findings and next steps shared in task notes and confirmed with requester https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1207031591185757.

Technical Requirements

    Review Salesforce Lead Assignment Rules (order, criteria, active rule entries).
    Review Flows related to Lead creation/update and ownership/routing logic.
    Check org-wide defaults related to Default Lead Owner, Web-to-Lead default owner, and any Queue handoffs.
    Confirm any associated Process Builder, Apex, or Trigger logic that can override ownership.
    Identify any scheduled jobs or integration processes that might reassign Leads post-creation.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Lead object
    Salesforce automation: Record-Triggered Flows (Lead), Queues, Default Lead Owner configuration
    Potentially: Process Builder (legacy), Apex Triggers/Classes if present, Integrations that set OwnerId

Triage Notes

    Nature: Investigation/support request focused on lead routing to a placeholder account.
    Impact: Sales team productivity and revenue capture; personal priority marked High with 3h lift.
    Next Steps:        Pull recent Leads assigned to the “Resting placeholder” user and review creation sources and timestamps.
        Trace routing logic execution path: assignment rule evaluation, flow decision points, any OwnerId updates.
        Compare expected rule criteria vs. actual Lead field values at creation.
        Document root cause and propose remediation approach with minimal disruption to existing routing.


Original Request (for context):
“This was a request from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1207031591185757 to investigate the Resting placeholder user and why leads are getting assigned and left on that user. This is going to require going over lead assignments and flows to look for the answer and understand the whole lead picture.”

data.name: [SFDC-2350] Align contract end date per order
data.notes:
Summary
The Fulfillment team requires the Daily Posters Salesforce report to display exactly one Contract End Date per poster order. Currently, the report returns multiple Contract End Date values per order due to improper configuration or relationship issues, creating data mismatches that prevent accurate fulfillment of NSC poster orders.

Value or Impact
This fix ensures accurate data flow for NSC poster order fulfillment (previously handled by Penguin), reducing operational delays and rework for the Fulfillment team. The issue directly impacts the ability to ship poster orders on time, creating potential client satisfaction and reputational risks if orders cannot be processed correctly.

Acceptance Criteria
• Contract End Date count equals poster order count in the report (1:1 relationship)
• No duplicate or extraneous Contract End Date rows appear for any poster order
• Validation confirmed by Ben Gores from Fulfillment using the linked report view
• Report accurately displays data for the target date range without duplication

Technical Details
The issue likely stems from the report pulling Contract End Dates from a many-to-many relationship or lacking proper filtering context. The solution requires updating the existing Salesforce report configuration to ensure Contract End Dates source from the correct relationship that uniquely corresponds to each poster order. This may involve adjusting report type relationships, adding appropriate filters for active/most recent contracts, or implementing formula/summary logic to select the intended Contract End Date.

Affected Systems
• Salesforce Reports and Dashboards (Lightning platform)
• Daily Posters report (Report ID: 00OUb00000B1uRdMAJ)
• Underlying Salesforce objects: poster orders and associated poster contracts
• Contract End Date field relationships and lookups

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Inspect the report type to confirm object relationships (many-to-one vs. many-to-many)
    Validate existing filters and add constraints for active/most recent poster contracts
    Test formula or summary logic if needed to select correct Contract End Date per order
    Reconcile row counts with Fulfillment team and obtain sign-off from Ben Gores
    Document the configuration changes for future reference

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
The Fulfillment team needs the Daily Posters Salesforce report to display exactly one Contract End Date per poster order. The current report returns multiple Contract End Dates per order due to configuration/relationship issues, causing mismatches and operational delays.

Business Value

    Ensures accurate data to fulfill NSC poster orders (previously provided by Penguin).
    Reduces rework and delays for Fulfillment; improves operational reliability.
    Prevents client and reputational risk by enabling timely, correct shipments.

Acceptance Criteria

    The count of Contract End Date values equals the count of poster orders in the report.
    No duplicate or extraneous Contract End Date rows appear for a given poster order.
    Validation confirmed by Fulfillment (Ben) on the linked report view for the target date range.

Technical Approach

    Update the existing Salesforce report configuration.
    Review and correct filters, groupings, joins/lookups, and the source field used for Contract End Date so it aligns with the poster contract record uniquely tied to each poster order.
    Ensure the Contract End Date field sources from the correct relationship that yields one value per order (avoid many-to-many duplication).
    Validation steps:    1.  Inspect the report type for object relationships (many-to-one vs. many-to-many).        Validate filters (e.g., active/most recent poster contract per order; relevant date constraints).
        If needed, add a formula/summary logic to select the intended Contract End Date per order.
        Reconcile row counts with Fulfillment and secure sign-off from Ben.


Affected Systems

    Salesforce Reports and Dashboards (Lightning)
    Underlying Salesforce objects/relationships used by the Daily Posters report (poster orders and associated poster contracts with Contract End Date)

Classification

    Ticket Type: Bug
    Scope: Rework or Adjustment
    Work Type: Reporting
    Impact Vector: Operations

Related Resources

    Report: https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Report/00OUb00000B1uRdMAJ/view?queryScope=userFolders
    Intake form submission: https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

Original Description

Summary
The Fulfillment team needs the "Daily Posters" Salesforce report to show one Contract End Date per poster order. Currently the report is returning too many Contract End Dates, creating a mismatch with poster orders. The fix requires adjusting the report configuration so Contract End Dates align with poster contracts for accurate fulfillment.

Value

    Ensures accurate data to fulfill NSC poster orders (previously provided by Penguin).
    Reduces rework and delays for the Fulfillment team; improves operational reliability.
    Prevents client and reputational risk by enabling timely, correct shipments.

Acceptance Criteria

    The count of Contract End Date values equals the count of poster orders in the report.
    No duplicate or extraneous Contract End Date rows appear for a given poster order.
    Validation confirmed by Fulfillment (Ben) on the linked report view for the target date range.

Technical Requirements

    Update the existing Salesforce report configuration at:
    https://safetyservicescompany.lightning.force.com/lightning/r/Report/00OUb00000B1uRdMAJ/view?queryScope=userFolders
    Review and correct: filters, groupings, joins/lookup fields, and the source field used for Contract End Date so it aligns to the poster contract record(s) associated with each poster order.
    Ensure the Contract End Date field sources from the correct relationship that uniquely corresponds to each poster order.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Reports and Dashboards (Lightning)
    Underlying Salesforce objects/relationships used by the "Daily Posters" report (poster orders and associated poster contracts with Contract End Date)

Triage Notes

    Classification: Bug; Scope: Rework/Adjustment; Work Type: Reporting; Impact Vector: Operations.
    
    Likely root cause: the report is pulling Contract End Date from a relationship that allows multiple related records or lacks proper filter/context, causing duplication.
    
    Next steps:    1.  Inspect the report type to confirm object relationships and whether a many-to-one vs. many-to-many is introducing duplicates.    1.  Validate filters (e.g., only active/most recent poster contract per order, relevant date constraints).        If needed, add a formula or summary logic to select the intended Contract End Date for each poster order.
        Reconcile row counts with Fulfillment and secure user sign-off (Ben).

    Assignee: https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672. Priority: High. Lift: 90 minutes with small QA buffer.

data.name: [SFDC-2360] Reset Salesforce sandbox password for Ben
data.notes:
Summary
Ben Gores from Fulfillment cannot access the Salesforce Partial Sandbox due to a password issue. The "Forgot my password" function indicates an email will be sent, but no reset email is being received. An admin password reset is required to restore sandbox access.

Value or Impact

    Restores critical sandbox access for Fulfillment team testing and development work
    Eliminates productivity loss from inability to access test environment
    Ensures Fulfillment can validate and test processes before production deployment
    Affected users: Ben Gores (primary), potentially other Fulfillment team members needing sandbox collaboration

Acceptance Criteria

    Admin successfully initiates password reset for Ben's Partial Sandbox account
    User receives reset instructions and confirms successful login
    If email delivery fails, temporary password is set with "change on next login" requirement
    Ben confirms ability to access and work in the Partial Sandbox environment

Technical Details

    Environment: Salesforce Partial Sandbox (not production)
    Reset method: Setup > Users > Reset Password function
    Alternative: Manual password set with forced change at next login
    Email system: Verify sandbox Email Deliverability settings (Setup > Deliverability)
    User email validation: Check for bounces or incorrect email address in sandbox

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Partial Sandbox environment
    User Management and Authentication module
    Email Deliverability system (for system-generated reset emails)
    Sandbox user profile and permissions

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Verify sandbox email deliverability settings are not blocking system emails
    Confirm Ben's email address is correct in sandbox user record
    Attempt standard Reset Password function
    If email fails, set temporary password with forced change requirement
    Confirm successful login with Ben and close ticket

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
Ben Gores from Fulfillment cannot log into the Salesforce partial sandbox and reports that "Forgot my password" indicates an email will be sent but none is received. The request is to perform an admin password reset to restore access.

Value

    Unblocks Fulfillment user's sandbox work and reduces downtime.
    Ensures ability to test/process Fulfillment-related tasks in the sandbox.

Acceptance Criteria

    Admin initiates a password reset for the user's Partial Sandbox account.
    User receives reset instructions and can successfully log in to the sandbox.
    If the email does not arrive, an alternative reset path (e.g., manual password set with "User must change password at next login") is completed and verified with the user.

Technical Requirements

    Salesforce Setup > Users: locate the user and use "Reset Password" (or set a temporary password and require change at next login).
    Verify sandbox Email Deliverability (Setup > Deliverability) is not restricting system emails.
    Confirm the user's email address is correct and not bouncing in sandbox (check Email Logs if needed).
    Environment: Salesforce Partial Sandbox (not production).

Affected Systems

    Salesforce (Partial Sandbox)
    User Management and Authentication
    Email Deliverability (system-generated emails)

Triage Notes

    Requester: Ben Gores (FULF - Fulfillment), Email: ben.gores@safetyservicescompany.com
    
    Issue summary: Password reset for partial sandbox; "Forgot my password" email not received.
    
    Approved by manager: Yes
    
    Importance to daily work: High; Impacted: Just Me
    
    Requested outcome: "reset password"
    
    Intake source: Technology Solutions Ticketing    -   https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429
    
    Next steps:    1.  Validate sandbox email deliverability and user email.    1.  Trigger Reset Password; if email fails, set a temporary password and require change on next login.        Confirm successful login with requester.

data.name: [SFDC-2366] Enable Event quick button for CSMs
data.notes:
Summary
CSMs and CSM leadership need the Event quick button in the Lightning Activity sidebar to create Events for customers, mirroring existing Sales functionality. This enables quick creation of follow-up Events from the activity composer. The request is approved by management and impacts the entire Client Success department.

Value or Impact

    Improves accountability and follow-up consistency under the new RACI process
    Increases CSM productivity and visibility for VIP agents and leadership  
    Aligns user experience across Sales and Client Success
    Affects 50-500 users across the entire Client Success department

Acceptance Criteria

    Event quick button is visible in the Lightning Activity sidebar for all CSMs and CSM leadership users
    Users in the above groups can successfully create new Events via the button
    Behavior/functionality matches existing Sales users' experience
    Spot-check: at least 3 representative CSM/CSM leadership users can create and save an Event on a real Account/Contact/Opportunity record without errors

Technical Details

    Mirror Sales configuration for the Event quick action in the Lightning Activity composer
    Verify/adjust Profiles and/or Permission Sets for CSM and CSM leadership to include required Event object permissions (create/read as appropriate)
    Confirm relevant Lightning Record Pages and Page Layouts expose the Event action in the Activity component for CSM contexts
    Ensure global/quick action configuration for Event is available to CSM profiles where the Activity composer is used

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Lightning Experience
    Activity Composer / Activity Timeline
    Event object
    Profiles, Permission Sets, Page Layouts, Lightning Record Pages (CSM and CSM leadership)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Inventory CSM/CSM leadership Profiles/Permission Sets and confirm Event create permission
    Compare Lightning page/activity configuration used by Sales vs. CSM layouts
    Enable Event action for CSM/CSM leadership in Activity composer; deploy to a small UAT group
    Validate acceptance criteria; then roll out to all CSM/leadership users

Request type: SFDC – Admin Support | Department: CUST – Client Success | Priority: High
Impact: Entire department/team (50–500 users)
Sales users already have this enabled; objective is parity for CSM/CSM leadership

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
CSMs and CSM leadership need the Event quick button in the Lightning Activity sidebar to create Events for customers, mirroring existing Sales functionality. This ensures quick creation of follow-up Events from the activity composer. The request is approved by management and impacts the entire Client Success department.

Value

    Improves accountability and follow-up consistency under the new RACI process
    Increases CSM productivity and visibility for VIP agents and leadership
    Aligns user experience across Sales and Client Success

Acceptance Criteria

    Event quick button is visible in the Lightning Activity sidebar for all CSMs and CSM leadership users
    Users in the above groups can successfully create new Events via the button
    Behavior/functionality matches existing Sales users' experience
    Spot-check: at least 3 representative CSM/CSM leadership users can create and save an Event on a real Account/Contact/Opportunity record without errors

Technical Requirements

    Mirror Sales configuration for the Event quick action in the Lightning Activity composer
    Verify/adjust Profiles and/or Permission Sets for CSM and CSM leadership to include required Event object perms (create/read as appropriate)
    Confirm relevant Lightning Record Pages and Page Layouts expose the Event action in the Activity component for CSM contexts
    Ensure global/quick action configuration for Event is available to CSM profiles where the Activity composer is used

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Lightning Experience
    Activity Composer / Activity Timeline
    Event object
    Profiles, Permission Sets, Page Layouts, Lightning Record Pages (CSM and CSM leadership)

Triage Notes

    Request type: SFDC – Admin Support | Department: CUST – Client Success | Priority: High
    Impact: Entire department/team (50–500 users)
    Sales users already have this enabled; objective is parity for CSM/CSM leadership
    Assumptions to validate:        CSM and CSM leadership are distinct Profiles and/or managed by Permission Sets
        Activity component used by CSMs supports Event action in the same way as Sales

    Next steps:        Inventory CSM/CSM leadership Profiles/Permission Sets and confirm Event create permission
        Compare Lightning page/activity configuration used by Sales vs. CSM layouts
        Enable Event action for CSM/CSM leadership in Activity composer; deploy to a small UAT group
        Validate acceptance criteria; then roll out to all CSM/leadership users


Original Intake Details (preserved)

    Requested by: Justin Bilodeau (justin.bilodeau@safetyservicescompany.com)
    Manager approval: Yes
    User Story: As a CSM/CSM management user, I want to be able to create events via a quick launch button in my activity history sidebar similar to tasks and calls.
    Why this matters: New RACI process to track accountability for CSM follow-up Events that VIP agents can also see
    Additional context: Sales agents already have this functionality; mirror to CSMs and CSM management
    How can we help today?: Salesforce
    Ticketing Source: Technology Solutions Ticketing (https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429)

data.name: [SFDC-2334] Remove unexpected Salesforce popup from attachment
data.notes:
Summary
An unexpected popup is appearing in Salesforce, reportedly triggered by an attached file. The reporter (Darrel from Sales) is experiencing this issue which is impacting their work with the Wasatch Heating & Air Inc. account. The exact nature of the popup and reproduction steps are currently unclear due to missing attachment and details.

Value or Impact
This bug is disrupting sales workflow and creating a poor user experience. It has high personal priority for the reporter and affects their ability to work efficiently in Salesforce. Resolution will restore normal system functionality and eliminate workflow interruptions.

Acceptance Criteria

    Popup no longer appears when interacting with attachments
    Normal Salesforce functionality is restored
    No unexpected UI elements interfere with user workflows
    Issue is verified resolved in the reporter's specific context (Wasatch Heating & Air Inc. records)

Technical Details

    Issue appears to be UI/UX related, possibly triggered by file attachment handling
    May involve JavaScript errors or browser compatibility issues
    Could be related to Salesforce Lightning component behavior
    Requires investigation of attachment upload/viewing mechanisms

Affected Systems

    Salesforce UI components
    File attachment handling system
    Potentially browser-specific rendering
    May affect multiple record types (Lead/Opportunity/Account/Quote)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Critical Information Needed: The referenced attachment was not accessible. Reporter must re-upload the file or provide:        Screenshot showing the exact popup
        Complete popup text/error message
        Specific page/record type where issue occurs
        Step-by-step reproduction path
        Browser type and version

    Once details are provided, can investigate root cause and implement fix
    May require browser console logs to diagnose JavaScript errors

----------------------------------------

Darrel

Email address:
Darrell.Martin@safetyservicescompany.com

SALE - Sales

Yes

Pop up un none source

go away

Salesforce
