data.name: [SFDC-2375] Enable RingCentral phone access in SFDC
data.notes:
Summary
Enable RingCentral softphone access in Salesforce for new hires Jessa Santos and Jeffrey Ranido so they can place and receive calls within the Salesforce UI.

Value

    Improves new-hire productivity and reduces onboarding friction for Client Success
    Centralizes calling activity in Salesforce for better logging and workflow

Acceptance Criteria

    Both users (Jessa Santos and Jeffrey Ranido) can sign in to the softphone within Salesforce without errors
    Each user can place one outbound test call from Salesforce (click-to-dial or dial pad) and the call connects
    Each user can receive an inbound test call with the softphone accessible in Salesforce
    Requester (Paula Silva) confirms functionality for both users

Technical Requirements

    Confirm telephony integration (RingCentral for Salesforce) is active in the org
    Assign/verify required Salesforce permissions for the telephony app/utility (app visibility, permission sets, utility bar access)
    Confirm both users exist in RingCentral Admin with active licenses/extensions
    Verify softphone utility is in the Lightning apps used by Client Success users
    Perform sign-in and connectivity checks for both users; capture any error details for remediation

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: User records, Permission Sets, Lightning App visibility, Utility Bar components
    RingCentral: Managed package in Salesforce and RingCentral Admin (licenses/users/extensions)

Triage Notes

    Requester: Paula Silva (CUST - Client Success); Manager approval: Yes
    Impacted users: New hires — Jessa Santos and Jeffrey Ranido; scope: Multiple people (2–9)
    Ticket source: Technology Solutions Ticketing form
    Related context: Ongoing RingCentral integration efforts active; no blockers noted for basic user enablement

Original Description (Retained)

Summary

Client Success requested enabling phone access inside Salesforce for two new hires, Jessa Santos and Jeffrey Ranido. The goal is for both users to use the telephony widget within Salesforce to place and receive calls. This supports onboarding and ensures they can work from day one within the Salesforce UI.

Value

    Improves new-hire productivity and reduces onboarding friction for Client Success.
    Centralizes calling activity inside Salesforce for better logging and workflow efficiency.

Acceptance Criteria

    Both users (Jessa Santos and Jeffrey Ranido) can sign in to the phone/softphone within Salesforce without errors.
    Each user can successfully place one outbound test call from Salesforce (click-to-dial or dial pad) and the call connects.
    Each user can receive an inbound test call with the softphone accessible in Salesforce.
    Requester (Paula Silva) confirms functionality for both users.

Technical Requirements

    Telephony integration available in Salesforce (e.g., RingCentral for Salesforce or equivalent) must be active in the org.
    Assign/confirm required Salesforce permissions for the telephony app/utility (e.g., app visibility, permission sets, utility bar access).
    Confirm the two users exist in the telephony provider's admin portal and have active licenses/extensions.
    Verify softphone utility is present in the target Lightning apps used by Client Success users.
    Perform sign-in flow and connectivity checks for both users; capture any error details for remediation if needed.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: User records, Permission Sets, Lightning App visibility, Utility Bar components.
    Telephony integration: RingCentral for Salesforce managed package and RingCentral Admin (licenses/users/extensions).

Triage Notes

    Requester: Paula Silva (CUST - Client Success); Manager approval: Yes.
    Impacted users: New hires — Jessa Santos and Jeffrey Ranido; impact scope: Multiple people (2–9).

    Open questions (if needed): confirm target Lightning app(s) for these users, required queues/teams, and whether SSO is expected for telephony login.

data.name: [SFDC-2381] Fix contact email save validation
data.notes:
Summary
Salesforce is preventing certain email addresses from being saved when creating or editing contacts on the Account page, causing users to get stuck on the edit screen. This validation issue is blocking data entry during live customer calls and affecting the entire sales team's productivity.

Value or Impact
This bug critically impacts sales operations by preventing timely data capture during customer interactions. With 500+ users affected company-wide, the inability to save valid email addresses disrupts the sales workflow, potentially leading to lost customer information and delayed follow-ups. The issue forces users to remain on the edit screen, unable to complete their work efficiently.

Acceptance Criteria

    Email field accepts all valid email formats according to standard RFC 5322 specifications
    Contact records save successfully with valid email addresses
    Invalid email formats produce clear, actionable validation messages
    Users can complete contact creation/editing workflow without getting stuck
    No false positives in email validation that reject legitimate addresses

Technical Details
The issue appears to be related to overly restrictive email validation rules in Salesforce. Based on the screenshot showing "jcassel@gomajornow.com" being rejected, the validation may be incorrectly flagging certain domain patterns or special characters. This likely involves the Contact object's Email field validation rule or potentially a custom validation trigger that needs adjustment.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Contact object
    Account page contact creation/editing interface
    Email field validation rules or triggers
    Potentially custom validation formulas or Apex triggers
    Sales Cloud data entry workflows

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Review current email validation rules on the Contact object
    Check for any custom validation rules or Apex triggers affecting the Email field
    Test with various email formats to identify the specific pattern causing rejection
    Adjust validation to accept standard email formats while maintaining data quality
    Consider implementing more specific error messages to guide users when validation fails

----------------------------------------

data.name: [SFDC-2376] Investigate Salesforce Latency and Access
data.notes:
Summary

    Users in CUST – Client Success report Salesforce latency and unresponsive behavior, with inability to access Accounts or update Account and Task records. Estimated impact: Multiple people (approx. 50–500).
    Objective: Restore responsiveness and access so teams can continue updating customer records without disruption.

Value or Impact

    Restores Client Success ability to work Accounts and Tasks, reducing delays in follow‑ups and protecting revenue operations and customer experience.

Acceptance Criteria

    Users can open Account records without unresponsive behavior.
    Account and Task pages load reliably; updates succeed without timeouts/failures.
    Impacted users validate normal responsiveness for Accounts and Tasks.
    No residual blockers reported by CUST – Client Success during validation.

Technical Details

    Org/Platform checks: Review Salesforce Trust for instance issues and org performance/health diagnostics and logs.
    Recent changes review: Flows, Apex, triggers, page layouts, list view/report filters, console configuration that could affect page performance or access.
    Security/sharing validation: Profiles, Permission Sets, Sharing rules, and OWD to rule out access- or performance-related constraints.
    Client-side/context: Browser and version, extensions, network/VPN status; reproduce in Incognito and an alternate browser. Capture HAR where possible.
    Comparative testing: Validate behavior across impacted profiles and a clean admin baseline.
    Deployment/config audit: Identify any recent deploys or config updates correlated to start of symptoms.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce objects/pages: Accounts, Tasks; potentially List Views, Reports, and Console used by Client Success.
    Relevant Salesforce components: Flows, Apex, Triggers, Page Layouts, Profiles/Permission Sets, Sharing/OWD, List View configurations.

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Triage details: Requester – Jhonri Serqui (jhonri.serquina@safetyservicescompany.com); Department – CUST – Client Success; Manager Approval – Yes; Impact – Multiple people (50–500); Personal Priority – Low; Source – Technology Solutions Ticketing (see Related Resources).
    Open questions to requester:        Timeframe/frequency: when did it start; continuous vs intermittent?
        Scope: which pages/objects (Accounts, Tasks, List Views, Reports, Console)?
        Affected users: 2–3 example users and their profiles/permission sets.
        Evidence: screenshots with timestamps, approximate load times, any error messages.
        Environment: network/VPN status; browser and version; results in Incognito and alternate browser.
        Localization: specific team/site vs org‑wide.

    Initial approach:        Check Salesforce Trust/performance for the instance; review org performance logs.
        Compare performance across user profiles and a clean admin baseline.
        Review recent deploys/config updates (flows/triggers/list views) that could affect load/access.
        Capture HAR files and page performance metrics where possible to reproduce.

    Related IDs/links for context:        Submission form: https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429
        IDs: SFDC-2376, TIE-2607, CUST-465


Original Description
Summary-   Reported Salesforce performance and access issue described as “Latency,” with users experiencing unresponsive behavior and inability to access Accounts and update account information and Tasks.  

    Request originates from CUST – Client Success; multiple people impacted (approx. 50–500). Objective is to restore responsiveness and access so teams can continue updating customer records.

Value

    Restores the ability for Client Success to work Accounts and Tasks, reducing delays in customer follow-ups and safeguarding revenue operations and customer experience.

Acceptance Criteria

    Users can access Account records without “unresponsive” behavior.
    Account and Task pages load reliably and allow updates without timeouts or failures.
    Impacted users confirm normal responsiveness when accessing Accounts and updating Tasks.
    No residual blockers reported by CUST – Client Success during validation.

Technical Requirements

    Perform org health checks and performance diagnostics in Salesforce (trust status, org performance logs).
    Review recent deployments/config changes that could affect page performance (flows, Apex, page layouts, list view filters, triggers).
    Validate profile/permission or record-level constraints that could manifest as access or performance issues.
    Gather client-side context (browser/version, extensions, network/VPN status); reproduce in Incognito and alternate browser.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Accounts, Tasks, potentially List Views/Reports/Console pages used by Client Success.
    Relevant Salesforce components: Flows/Apex/Triggers, Page Layouts, Profiles/Permission Sets, Sharing/OWD, List View configurations.

data.name: [SFDC-2358] Restore RingCentral Click-to-Dial Logging in Salesforce
data.notes:
Summary

    The RingCentral embedded phone in Salesforce is not activating/logging when initiating calls via click-to-dial from a Contact. The user can dial, but the softphone does not engage, and calls are not auto-logged.
    Goal: Restore click-to-dial behavior and automatic call/activity logging for the impacted user.

Value or Impact

    Restores accurate activity tracking for Client Success, supporting productivity, reporting, and revenue-adjacent workflows tied to client outreach and support.
    Prevents manual logging and ensures consistent activity data for operations and performance measurement.

Acceptance Criteria

    Clicking a phone field in Salesforce opens the RingCentral softphone and places the call successfully.
    Call records automatically log to the correct Salesforce record (Contact/Account/Lead) with call duration and direction.
    No manual logging required for standard outbound calls.
    Behavior verified for the impacted user (Leizl Nesperos) in the target Salesforce app and browser.

Technical Details

    Validate RingCentral for Salesforce integration and user session/auth status.
    Confirm user assignment to the correct Call Center/CTI adapter and softphone layout.
    Verify click-to-dial settings, activity log settings, and necessary Salesforce permissions for Activity capture.
    Confirm the RingCentral softphone loads in the Salesforce Lightning utility/CTI panel and that browser pop-ups/permissions do not block it.
    Check browser-level permissions/pop-up blockers; clear cache/cookies; assess extension conflicts.
    Reproduce using the same Contact and browser; collect console/network logs if the softphone fails to initialize.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Lightning UI, Activities/Tasks logging, Click-to-Dial.
    RingCentral: CTI softphone embedded in Salesforce (RingCentral for Salesforce integration).

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Single-user impact currently (Leizl Nesperos). Begin with auth/session validation and CTI Call Center assignment for the user.
    Verify RingCentral login state within Salesforce and that the softphone utility loads without browser interference.
    If the issue persists, capture console/network logs during a click-to-dial attempt for escalation to RingCentral support if needed.
    Broaden scope and investigate org-wide configuration only if additional users report similar symptoms.

Original Description
Summary

    The RingCentral embedded phone in Salesforce is not activating/logging when initiating calls via click-to-dial from a Contact. The user can dial, but the softphone does not engage, and calls are not auto-logged.
    Goal: Restore click-to-dial behavior and automatic call/activity logging for the impacted user.

Value

    Restores accurate activity tracking for Client Success, supporting productivity, reporting, and revenue-adjacent workflows tied to client outreach and support.

Acceptance Criteria

    Clicking a phone field in Salesforce opens the RingCentral softphone and places the call successfully.
    Call records automatically log to the correct Salesforce record (Contact/Account/Lead) with call duration and direction.
    No manual logging required for standard outbound calls.
    Behavior verified for the impacted user (Leizl Nesperos) in the target Salesforce app and browser.

Technical Checks

    Validate RingCentral for Salesforce integration and user session/auth status.
    Confirm user assignment to the correct Call Center/CTI adapter and softphone layout.
    Verify click-to-dial settings, activity log settings, and necessary Salesforce permissions for Activity capture.
    Confirm the RingCentral softphone loads in the Salesforce Lightning utility/CTI panel and that browser pop-ups/permissions do not block it.
    Browser-level permissions/pop-up blockers; cache/cookie or extension conflicts.
    Reproduce using the same Contact and browser; collect console/network logs if the softphone fails to initialize.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Lightning UI, Activities/Tasks logging, Click-to-Dial
    RingCentral: CTI softphone embedded in Salesforce (RingCentral for Salesforce integration)

Reporter and Scope

    Reported by: Leizl Nesperos (leizl.nesperos@safetyservicescompany.com), Dept: CUST – Client Success
    Symptom: “When I click on the contact in SF it dials it but nothing happens on the built in phone within ISN so unable to log the calls. I log it manually.”
    Scope: Currently single user impact; broaden scope if similar reports arise.

Related Resources

    Submitted via Technology Solutions Ticketing: https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

Original Description

Summary-   The RingCentral embedded phone in Salesforce is not activating/logging when initiating calls via click-to-dial from a Contact. The user can dial, but the softphone does not engage, and calls are not auto-logged.    Goal is to restore click-to-dial behavior and automatic call/activity logging for the user.

Value

    Restores accurate activity tracking for Client Success, supporting productivity, reporting, and revenue-adjacent workflows tied to client outreach and support.

Acceptance Criteria

    Clicking a phone field in Salesforce opens the RingCentral softphone and places the call successfully.
    Call records automatically log to the correct Salesforce record (Contact/Account/Lead) with call duration and direction.
    No manual logging required for standard outbound calls.
    Behavior verified for the impacted user (Leizl Nesperos) in the target Salesforce app and browser.

Technical Requirements

    Validate RingCentral for Salesforce integration and user session/auth status.
    Confirm user assignment to the correct Call Center/CTI adapter and softphone layout.
    Verify click-to-dial settings, activity log settings, and necessary Salesforce permissions for Activity capture.
    Confirm the RingCentral softphone loads in the Salesforce Lightning utility/CTI panel and that browser pop-ups/permissions do not block it.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce: Lightning UI, Activities/Tasks logging, Click-to-Dial.
    RingCentral: CTI softphone embedded in Salesforce (RingCentral for Salesforce integration).

Triage Notes

    Reported by: Leizl Nesperos (leizl.nesperos@safetyservicescompany.com), Dept: CUST – Client Success.
    Symptom: “When I click on the contact in SF it dials it but nothing happens on the built in phone within ISN so unable to log the calls. I log it manually.”
    Scope: Currently single user impact; broaden scope if similar reports arise.
    Suggested checks:    -   Ensure RingCentral login within Salesforce and extension/app are active; confirm correct environment and that the softphone panel loads.    -   Confirm user is assigned to the correct Call Center and has the appropriate profile/permission sets for CTI and Activity logging.        Validate click-to-dial is enabled; check softphone layout and logging settings.
        Browser-level permissions/pop-up blockers; cache/cookie or extension conflicts.
        Reproduce using the same Contact and browser; collect console/network logs if the softphone fails to initialize.


Original Request Details

    Name: Leizl Nesperos
    Email: leizl.nesperos@safetyservicescompany.com
    Department: CUST - Client Success
    Request Type: SFDC - Bug
    “DONE” stated by requester: Working RC in SF, logging calls.

data.name: [SFDC-2371] Create Batch Invoicing for Fulfillment in Salesforce
data.notes:
Summary
Create a “Batch Invoices” capability in Salesforce that allows Fulfillment to select a target date and download all invoices requiring fulfillment, grouped by product type. This replicates the prior Invoicing App’s “Batch Invoice” function to streamline daily preparation.

Value or Impact

    Simplifies daily fulfillment prep by generating dated, product-grouped invoice sets.
    Reduces manual effort and mitigates current inefficiencies attributed to Waddle.
    Impacted users: Entire Fulfillment team (approx. 2–9 users).

Acceptance Criteria

    A “Batch Invoices” button is available in Salesforce.
    User can select a target date.
    System identifies invoices requiring fulfillment for the selected date.
    System generates individual invoices for that date.
    Output is organized into folders by product type:        Meetings – First Time
        Meetings – Renewals
        Labor Law Posters
        Kits
        Manuals
        MMS

    Fulfillment can download the grouped invoices for that date.
    Basic error handling and user feedback are provided (e.g., no invoices found for date).

Technical Details

    Trigger: “Batch Invoices” button in Salesforce (location/object TBD).
    Input: User-selected target date.
    Logic:        Identify “invoices requiring fulfillment” for the chosen date. (Exact criteria/fields to determine “requires fulfillment” are not provided.)
        Generate individual invoice records/files for each qualifying invoice.
        Group output by product type into discrete folders as listed above.

    Output/Delivery:        Provide a method to download grouped invoices (e.g., packaged files or downloadable folders). Storage destination (Salesforce Files vs. external storage) not specified.

    Data points/objects: Invoices and product type classification. (Exact Salesforce object names/fields not provided.)
    Parity goal: Replicate prior Invoicing App “Batch Invoice” behavior.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce (Invoices, related Product/Line Item data, Files/Document handling).
    Fulfillment operational workflow.
    Legacy reference: Prior “Invoicing App” feature (for behavioral parity).
    Waddle is referenced as a driver for simplification; no integration changes requested here.

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Clarify definition of “requires fulfillment” (object/field criteria, status, and date field used).
    Confirm where the “Batch Invoices” button will live (object/page layout vs. app page).
    Confirm storage/packaging approach for grouped downloads (Salesforce Files, zipped export, or other).
    Validate product type mapping rules to ensure invoices land in the correct group.
    Confirm whether output should include subfolder naming conventions and file naming standards.
    If any due date is set, verify alignment with Lift; otherwise, plan within Lift window.

Original Description (as submitted via Technology Solutions Ticketing)
Request Summary
Create batch invoicing in Salesforce that lets Fulfillment select a date and download all invoices requiring fulfillment, grouped by product type. This replicates the prior Invoicing App “Batch Invoice” capability.

Requested Groupings

    Meetings – First Time
    Meetings – Renewals
    Labor Law Posters
    Kits
    Manuals
    MMS

Desired Behavior / Acceptance Criteria

    A “Batch Invoices” button is available in Salesforce.
    User can choose a target date.
    System generates individual invoices for that date and groups them into folders by the product types listed above.
    Fulfillment can download the grouped invoices for that date.

Business Rationale and Impact

    Simplifies daily fulfillment preparation; helps counteract inefficiencies of Waddle.
    Impacted: Entire Fulfillment team; approx. 2–9 users.
    Personal Priority: High.
    Department: Fulfillment (FULF).
    Request Type: SFDC – Feature Request.
    Reporter: Ben Gores (ben.gores@safetyservicescompany.com).

Related Resources
https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

Original Description
————————
Name:
Ben Gores

Email address:
ben.gores@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
FULF - Fulfillment

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Create Batch Invoicing in SF

Use this space to explain what you need.:
When we were invoicing through Invoicing App there was a function to "Batch Invoice". You selected the day you wanted then it would create a folder with all the invoices from that day broken down in subcategories by product type... 1) Meetings - First Time 2) Meetings - Renewals 3) Labor Law Posters 4) Kits 5) Manuals 6) MMS. I would like SF to create something similar where Fulfillment can download all the invoices that require fulfillment for a given day broken out by product type. 

This is what DONE looks like:
There will be a button in SF for Batch invoices. When you click on it you can choose the day you want the invoices for. It will create individual invoices and group them in folders by topic. 

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Feature Request

Please fully describe this Feature:
When we were invoicing through Invoicing App there was a function to "Batch Invoice". You selected the day you wanted then it would create a folder with all the invoices from that day broken down in subcategories by product type... 1) Meetings - First Time 2) Meetings - Renewals 3) Labor Law Posters 4) Kits 5) Manuals 6) MMS. I would like SF to create something similar where Fulfillment can download all the invoices that require fulfillment for a given day broken out by product type. 

Acceptance Criteria:
There will be a button in SF for Batch invoices. When you click on it you can choose the day you want the invoices for. It will create individual invoices and group them in folders by topic. 

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
S - Simplify

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
Create a Batch Invoice function in Sales Force

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Entire Department or Team

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
2-9

Additional Context:
This will help counter act some of the inefficiencies of Waddle. 

———————————————

data.name: [SFDC-2355] Align RingCentral App and Logging
data.notes:
Summary
Three sales reps (Chris Smollack, Keving Marcus, and Nick Kempton) are using the RingCentral Lightning app instead of Sales Lightning, resulting in call/handle time not being captured as logged calls in reporting. The request is to align their Salesforce setup with teammates (reference users: Monique Romero and James Skulemowski) so that activity logging and reporting function as expected.

Value or Impact

    Ensures consistent configuration and user experience across the sales team.
    Restores accurate call logging and reporting for pipeline visibility and performance metrics.
    Reduces data gaps that impact sales performance analysis.

Acceptance Criteria

    Salesforce configuration for Chris Smollack, Keving Marcus, and Nick Kempton matches the team’s standard configuration (use Monique Romero and James Skulemowski as references).
    Calls made/received via RingCentral are captured as logged call activities and appear correctly in relevant Salesforce call/handle-time reports for the three users.
    Reporter confirms parity with teammates and correct reporting behavior.

Technical Details

    Verify and align Lightning app selection (Sales Lightning vs. RingCentral Lightning app) for the three affected users.
    Verify RingCentral for Salesforce configuration at the user level (e.g., CTI/softphone access, app permissions) to ensure activity logging works as expected.
    Compare settings for the affected users against reference users (Monique Romero and James Skulemowski) and align as needed.
    No new development requested; this is an admin/configuration update.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Lightning Apps (App Launcher/app assignments)
    Salesforce user profile/permission set configuration related to RingCentral
    RingCentral for Salesforce integration (CTI/softphone and activity logging)
    Salesforce reporting on call activities/handle time

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Reporter: Sarah Hildestad (SALE - Sales); priority marked Critical; manager approval: Yes.
    Affected users: Chris Smollack, Keving Marcus, Nick Kempton; reference users: Monique Romero, James Skulemowski.
    Observed behavior: call/handle time not captured as logged calls for affected users.
    Tip: Users can switch to Sales Lightning via the App Launcher (9 dots) and selecting “Sales Lightning”; still verify admin-side configuration and RingCentral logging behavior.
    Related Resources: Tip from https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211422890274672; discussed with Dan on 10/13/25; submitted as a single ticket for three agents.
    Blockers/Dependencies: (Information not provided.)

data.name: [SFDC-2377] Clarify Scope and Requirements
data.notes:
Summary
    This task is to clarify the problem statement, affected users, and expected outcomes for Salesforce ticket SFDC-2377 so the work can be sized, scheduled, and executed. The deliverable is a succinct, testable scope with stakeholders and acceptance tests confirmed.
    
    Value or Impact
    Enables accurate sizing, prioritization, and assignment of SFDC-2377.
    Reduces rework and cycle time by capturing requirements early.
    Aligns work to operational/revenue impact and stakeholder needs.

3. Acceptance Criteria

    Problem/feature ask documented in 1–3 sentences.
    Affected users and business impact documented (who, how many, severity).
    Expected outcome/definition of success documented.
    Acceptance tests listed and testable.
    Lift estimate validated or updated (currently conflicting: 3h noted in comments vs. 45m field).
    TS fields validated (TS Product, Ticket Type, Impact Vector, Status).
    Stakeholders/approvers identified.
    Next steps and owner confirmed.

4. Technical Details

    SFDC ID: SFDC-2377
    Objects/flows/integrations/APIs: (Information not provided.)
    Environments and deployment constraints: (Information not provided.)
    Related systems/integrations: (Information not provided.)

    Salesforce (org-wide)
    Specific objects/flows/integrations: TBD

    Request reporter to provide: problem statement (1–3 sentences), affected users, expected outcome, acceptance tests, any known Salesforce objects/flows/integrations/APIs, environments (Prod/Sandbox), deployment constraints, stakeholders/approvers, and confirm/update Lift.
    Field consistency check:        Lift inconsistency: Comment indicates “3 hrs – Medium”; fields currently show “45 Min – Very Small” and Estimated time = 45m. Needs validation.
        Due date alignment: If “Medium (~3h)”, guidance suggests due within 4 days. Current due date is Oct 23, 2025 5:00 PM; review for accuracy once Lift is confirmed.

    Current ticket fields (from triage/classification): TS Product = Salesforce; Ticket Type = Support; Scope of Work = Routine Work; Impact Vector = Operations; Who is Affected = Just Me; Number Impacted = Just Me; Risk MS = Productivity, Strategic Alignment; Department = TIE – Technology Integration & Engineering; TS-Status = Internal Review; Assignee = https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1211080817815794.

Clarify the problem/ask, affected users, and expected outcome for SFDC-2377 so work can be scheduled and executed.

project.name: TIE - Technology Integration & Engineering Departmental Hub

data.name: [SFDC-2378] Resolve RingCentral Call Sync Issues
data.notes:
Summary
RingCentral–Salesforce integration issues are disrupting sales workflows. Symptoms include delayed click-to-dial, call logs not saving/syncing, and intermittent missing/delayed notes. Triage, root-cause analysis, and remediation are requested in coordination with RingCentral engineering.

Value or Impact

    Affects outbound and inbound call workflows across multiple sales users.
    Reduces sales efficiency and degrades customer communication quality.
    Impacted population: Entire team (10–49 users). Priority: Critical.

Acceptance Criteria

    Click-to-dial initiates promptly from Salesforce with no multi-minute lag.
    Call notes and call logs sync reliably to the correct Salesforce records.
    No observable lag between Salesforce and RingCentral interactions.
    Integration configuration is documented and approved by RingCentral engineers.
    Changes are tested in sandbox and successfully rolled out to production.

Technical Details

    Integration surface area: RingCentral Salesforce app/config, CTI click-to-dial, call log/notes sync.
    Activities include triage of logging and app configuration, and validation of SFDC-side integration mapping.
    Coordination with RingCentral engineering for logging, app configuration, and API/event delivery validation.
    Testing plan: Validate fixes in Salesforce Sandbox before Production deployment.
    Internal References: SFDC-2378; TIE-2611.
    Ticketing form: https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429
    Additional specifics (fields, flows, APIs, object mappings): (Information not provided.)

Affected Systems

    RingCentral platform and RingCentral for Salesforce integration.
    Salesforce (Lightning experience; integration mapping; call activity/logging). 
    Related APIs/events/webhooks for call and note synchronization. 
    Specific Salesforce objects/flows: (Information not provided.)

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Triage integration to identify root cause of click-to-dial lag and sync failures.
    Establish a recurring cadence with RingCentral engineers to review logs, app config, and event delivery.
    Validate SFDC-side integration mapping; reproduce issues and test remediation in sandbox.
    Proceed to production deployment after successful sandbox validation and required sign-offs.
    Known blockers/risks: (Information not provided.)

Related Resources

    Ticketing form: https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429
    Internal IDs: SFDC-2378, TIE-2611

data.name: [SFDC-2373] Add Partnerships Office ID in Salesforce
data.notes:
Summary
Add a dedicated Salesforce Office ID to identify and track sales made through existing partnerships. This will enable clear attribution of partner-driven revenue and support consistent reporting and forecasting for the partnership channel as it scales.

Value or Impact

    Improves revenue attribution accuracy for partnership channel
    Enables consistent reporting and forecasting on partner-sourced deals  
    Supports Strategic Growth initiatives as partnerships expand
    Initially affects 2-9 users with expected growth as partnerships scale

Acceptance Criteria

    A distinct Office ID value for "Partnerships" is created and available in Salesforce
    Proposed value (246 or 369) is validated against existing Office IDs to prevent collisions
    Office ID can be selected/applied in relevant workflows to mark partner-sourced sales
    Office ID appears in all relevant picklists/inputs where Office ID is set
    Existing reports and dashboards can filter/summarize sales using the new Partnerships Office ID

Technical Details

    Confirm canonical Office ID data model (object/field, data type, naming conventions)
    Validate proposed ID values (246 or 369) against existing Office ID catalog
    Configure Office ID value following established naming/numbering standards
    Verify visibility and permissions align with current Office ID usage patterns
    Confirm compatibility with existing reporting infrastructure

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Sales Cloud: Office ID configuration and selection interfaces
    Salesforce Reporting/Dashboards: All reports referencing Office ID field
    Any forms/flows where Office ID is set or defaulted

Next Steps or Analyst Notes

    Awaiting confirmation of authoritative Office ID object/field structure
    Need to validate whether Office ID is picklist vs numeric code
    Confirm if downstream automation or defaulting rules are in scope
    Requester preference for ID value 246 with "multiplier" theme rationale
    No new report builds assumed unless specifically requested

----------------------------------------

Original Description (Retained)

Summary
The request is to add a Salesforce Office ID dedicated to identifying sales made through existing partnerships. The intent is to enable clear attribution and reporting for partner-driven revenue.

Value

    Improves revenue attribution for partnership channel
    Enables consistent reporting and forecasting on partner-sourced deals
    Supports Strategic Growth initiatives as partnerships scale

Acceptance Criteria

    A distinct Office ID value for "Partnerships" is created and available for use in Salesforce.
    Proposed value to confirm: 246 (requester suggestion; 369 also suggested). Final value must not collide with existing Office IDs.
    The Office ID can be selected/applied in the intended workflow to mark partner-sourced sales.
    Basic validation: Office ID appears in relevant picklists/inputs where Office ID is set (scope to be confirmed).
    Reporting can filter/summarize sales using the Partnerships Office ID.

Technical Requirements

    Confirm the canonical "Office ID" data model (object/field, data type, value conventions, and governance/ownership).
    Validate no ID collisions with existing Office IDs; adhere to naming/numbering standards.
    Add/configure the Partnerships Office ID value and make it available in the places where Office ID is set.
    Verify visibility/permissions align with current Office ID usage.
    Confirm reports/dashboards can filter by the new Office ID (no new report builds in this scope unless requested).

Affected Systems

    Salesforce (Sales Cloud) — Office ID configuration and any forms/flows where it is set
    Salesforce Reporting and Dashboards that reference Office ID

Triage Notes

    Requester: Julia Taylor (STRG - Strategic Growth) — Julia.Taylor@safetyservicescompany.com
    Approval: Yes
    Priority and Impact: Critical; Multiple People; 2–9 initially with expectation to grow as partnerships expand
    Request detail: "A SF Office ID to identify sales made through existing partnerships." Suggested numeric ID: 246 (or 369), rationale: "multiplier" theme
    Flags/Questions:        Confirm the authoritative object/field used for Office ID (e.g., Opportunity, Account, or custom object) and whether it's a picklist vs numeric code.
        Validate the ID value against existing Office ID catalog to avoid collisions and follow conventions.
        Confirm if any downstream automation, defaulting rules, or dashboards are in scope now (not assumed in this ticket).

    Reference: Submitted via Technology Solutions Ticketing
    https://form.asana.com/?k=fiideHFJeymhykmEGYMuNg&d=169426931772429

data.name: [SFDC-2352] Fix RingCentral Click-to-Dial Connection
data.notes:
Summary

Sales user Amanda Apodaca reported that RingCentral could not connect to the server and click-to-dial was not functioning in Salesforce. On 2025-10-14, support cleared browser cache/cookies, closed the browser, and had the user re-login; functionality was restored and the user confirmed resolution. This ticket documents the incident, impact, and resolution steps.

Value

    Restores outbound calling workflows for Sales, preventing lost productivity and potential revenue impact.
    Ensures the RingCentral CTI functions as expected in Salesforce, reducing support interruptions.

Acceptance Criteria

    User can log into the RingCentral for Salesforce integration without connection errors.
    Click-to-dial initiates successfully from Salesforce records (e.g., Leads/Contacts) without error.
    User confirms the issue is resolved and dialing works in their normal workflow.
    Resolution steps and any relevant observations are recorded in the task.

Technical Requirements

    RingCentral for Salesforce CTI must authenticate and load in Salesforce Lightning.
    Browser session/cache should not prevent RingCentral CTI initialization.
    No changes to Salesforce permission sets, CTI softphone setup, or dialer configuration were required for this resolution.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Lightning Experience (CTI softphone panel)
    RingCentral for Salesforce integration
    End-user web browser (cache/cookies/session)

Triage Notes

    Reporter: Amanda Apodaca (SALE - Sales), Email: amanda.apodaca@safetyservicescompany.com
    Severity/Priority: Critical (personal), impact limited to a single user.
    Steps performed (2025-10-14): Connected via Teams; cleared browser cache and cookies; closed all browsers; user re-logged in; issue no longer reproduced; user confirmed fix. Per https://app.asana.com/0/profile/1209729485132555.
    Classification: SFDC - Bug; Scope: Quick Fix; Lift: Micro.
    IDs: SFDC ID: SFDC-2352; TIE Reference: TIE-2537.
    Recommendation: Monitor for recurrence. If issue reappears, capture specific error messages, browser details, and exact Salesforce page/context for deeper investigation.

----------------------------------------

Original Submission (for reference):    “RC can't connect to server/won't click to dial” repeated across description fields.
    Department: SALE - Sales
    How important: Critical
    Impacted: Just Me
    Additional Context: “RC can't connect to server/won't click to dial”

data.name: [SFDC-2357] Fix AE Review Name Update
data.notes:
Summary
Nicholas Kempton reports that the AE Review section in Salesforce is incomplete: his name does not update when changes are made, and a field appears to be missing. Attachments are referenced by the requester but are not visible here.

Value
Ensures accurate AE attribution in Salesforce, reducing confusion in sales workflows and supporting correct ownership, reporting, and follow-up.

Acceptance Criteria

    When changes are made in the AE Review section, the AE name for Nicholas Kempton updates correctly and persists on refresh.
    Any missing AE-related field identified during analysis is added/visible per approved configuration and security settings.
    Validation steps documented and shared with the requester; requester confirms resolution.

Technical Requirements

    Identify the object and fields powering the “AE Review” section (object/layout TBD) and verify:        Field-Level Security (FLS), profile/permission set access
        Page layout/Lightning record page visibility

    Review and adjust relevant automation that sets or syncs AE fields (e.g., Flow/Process Builder/Apex) if found to block or overwrite updates.
    Confirm no validation rule or duplicate rule prevents the update.
    Review referenced attachments (screenshots) once available to confirm exact field labels/locations.

Affected Systems

    Salesforce Sales Cloud
    Page Layouts/Lightning Record Pages
    Profiles/Permission Sets (FLS)
    Salesforce Flow/Process Builder/Apex (if present for AE sync)

Triage Notes

    Reporter: Nicholas Kempton (nicholas.kempton@safetyservicescompany.com); Department: SALE – Sales; Manager approval: Yes
    Priority: Critical; Impact: Just Me
    Intake title/summary: “AE Review section incomplete”
    Additional context: “my name won’t update when changes are made to AE review section, missing a field please see attachments”; attachments not visible here
    Initial next steps:        Identify precise object/record type and the “AE Review” component/fields
        Check FLS and layout visibility for the AE fields
        Review any automation that could be overwriting the AE name after save
        Reproduce the issue; capture before/after field values and debug logs if needed
        Implement fix; validate with requester

    Original intake placeholders present with no detail: “This is what DONE looks like: .”, “Examples: .”, “User Story: .”, “Acceptance Criteria: .”, “Why this matters: .”

data.name: [SFDC-2315] Fix Invoice Access for Sales User
data.notes:
Name:
Sarah Di Stefano

Email address:
sarah.distefano@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
SALE - Sales

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Cannot review invoices

Use this space to explain what you need.:
Cannot open invoices for review within the system. issue occurs when attempting to view invoice, preventing visibility. Asking for stripe email on account page that has already been entered.

This is what DONE looks like:
DONE = I am able to open all invoice files in the system without error, view their full contents, including line items and what has been paid.

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Admin Support

Please give any examples or additional details to help narrow down this task.:
Examples / Additional Details: When I click on invoices in the system, they do not open — I cannot view the details or download them. I need to be able to access and review invoice contents directly so I can explain to the client what has been paid.

Setup / Permission Change Needed: Likely an access or permissions issue preventing invoice documents from opening. Please confirm and correct access so invoices are viewable.

User Story:
ability to open and view all invoice files in the system, so that I can verify what has been paid and clearly explain billing details to clients.

AI Cleanup Note: DONE = Invoice files open successfully without error, contents are fully viewable

Acceptance Criteria:
Acceptance Criteria

User (Sarah Di Stefano) can open invoice files directly from the system without encountering errors.

Invoice documents display full details (invoice number, date, line items, totals, payment status) in a readable format.
DONE = Invoices are consistently viewable, downloadable and I can see credits

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
E - Experience

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
User cannot open invoice files with detailed line items. This impacts the ability to explain to clients what has been paid.

How important is this to your daily work?:
Critical

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Just Me

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
2-9

Additional Context:
Client is upset and I need to walk through it with him within the next 90 minutes.

data.name: [SFDC-2318] Fix Files Section Access Issue
data.notes:
Name:
Sarah M DiStefano

Email address:
sarah.distefano@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
SALE - Sales

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Unable to update file on account page for adding order information/logo

Use this space to explain what you need.:
I have a logo that needs to get uploaded for fulfillment to put on an HSE manual. I cannot access the files section of the sales facing account page. 

This is what DONE looks like:
DONE = I can access the Files section of the sales-facing account page without error and successfully upload required documentation.

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Bug

Steps to Reproduce:
I scroll to bottom of account screen where the files are uploaded/stored and it doesn't generate visibility. No error message content.

Expected vs Actual Behavior:
Need to upload files to account, cannot do so.

Rate the Severity:
7 out of 10

User Story:
I want access to the Files section of the sales-facing account page so that I can upload client logos and supporting documents directly, ensuring fulfillment has the correct materials for HSE manual production without delays or workarounds.

Acceptance Criteria:
DONE = I can open the Files section, upload the logo successfully, confirm it saves under the correct account record, and fulfillment can retrieve it for printing.

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
C - Centralize

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
Fulfillment cannot complete new HSE manuals without the correct client logo, which delays delivery and impacts client satisfaction. Having the ability to upload logos directly into the account ensures everything is Centralized under one secure system, aligning with ESCAPE by keeping compliance materials unified, reducing back-and-forth, and ensuring accuracy in final deliverables.

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
Just Me

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
Just Me

Additional Context:
As soon as I started to fill out this ticket, it started working again, so it may have been slowing and bottlnecking again. I appreciate your attention.

———————————————

data.name: [SFDC-2332] Exclude Manual Builder from CSM Task Assignment
data.notes:
Name:
Lora Duran

Email address:
lora.duran@safetyservicescompany.com

Which Department are you representing?:
MKTG - Marketing & Knowledge

Has your manager approved this ticket?:
Yes

Describe this issue in five words or less. This is used as guidance for the title.:
Remove Automated Task on Manual Builder

Use this space to explain what you need.:
As of now, all closed/won opportunities have an automatic task assigned to a CSM for a follow-up call. We do not want any Manual Builder going to CSMs, only to Ryan Lugo. We would like the automated task assignment to have an exception for Manual Builder and not automatically send to a CSM. 

This is what DONE looks like:
Done would be when there are not automatically assigned follow-up tasks to CSMs for any Manual Builder closed/won opportunity.

How can we help you today?:
Salesforce

What kind of Salesforce request is this?:
SFDC - Admin Support

Please give any examples or additional details to help narrow down this task.:
There is an automated flow to assign a follow up task to all CSMs after an opportunity turns into closed/won. We want to create an exception to the rule for Manual Builder. We do not want CSMs to handle any Manual Builder accounts. 

User Story:
As a marketer in charge of Manual Builder, I want CSMs to be removed from all Manual Builder accounts to minimize contact points and centralize the accounts to one person (Ryan Lugo) for follow-up. 

Acceptance Criteria:
Done would be when there are not automatically assigned follow-up tasks to CSMs for any Manual Builder closed/won opportunity.

Select which element of our ESCAPE philosophy best fits with this ticket.:
S - Simplify

Why does this matter to the business or client?:
We do not want multiple people contacting the customer after they purchase a manual. We only want Ryan to reach out as an opportunity to upsell (essentially a new lead). We are trying to simplify the communication the customer receives from us. 

How important is this to your daily work?:
High

Choose who is MOST impacted by this issue:
External Customers

How many customers or staff does this issue impact?:
10-49

Additional Context:
If there is not a way to make an exception to the flow, we would rather it have an automated assignment to one person instead of round robin CSM style. 

———————————————
